Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, full kitchen, great breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be away from the strip and this was the perfect place. Quiet, out of the way, reasonable-sized hotel, pet-friendly, green, with special hybrid parking. The rooms are comfortable, reasonably priced, and the king suites have full kitchens. The staff are very helpful and offer suggestions for nearby dining. The breakfast includes an egg-white option and the smoothies are yummy! Nice pool with cabanas too. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Why can't more hotels do this?”
Reviews.Author: bradskippy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Element for my first time last Sunday and it was phenomenal! I wanted to get away from the Las Vegas strip and have a relaxing night on my own. The Element was about a 15 drive (or less) away and was perfect for me. It's a smaller hotel and all eco-friendly. The room had beautiful amenities and I could tell everything was done Green and to LEED standards. This made for a very enjoyable experience and got me thinking, "Why can't all hotels go Green?". Grant,at the front desk, checked me in and was great. He recommended his favorite restaurant and told me about the area as well. Really nice personality and was helpful. I also met David, the GM, in the morning and he was extremely helpful as well. First-class hotel in all regards and I look forward to heading back soon. I hope Westin starts building more Element properties around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Fun "Green" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bound4NZ
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a family hotel to stay at off the Strip. Booked it through Hotwire, so we had NO idea what this hotel was about. It was a pleasant surprise. They call themselves a "Green Hotel." It was an interesting experience. They rent mountain bikes at the front desk for free and the hotel gym takes up a large chunk of the first floor. For breakfast they offer fruit smoothies, but they are in the size of a shot glass, so you need to drink about 10 to equal one smoothie. Other than that, I would stay there again. We paid $80 for a room with 2 double beds and a kitchenette. Also, President Obama stayed at this hotel when he visited Vegas in early 2012, so you can brag to your friends that you stay where the President stays.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for, Off-the-Strip!”
Reviews.Author: na711cho
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Element Hotel in Las Vegas. I am familiar with this Eco-minded hotel from Westin as I have attended some business functions with my company at their Denver property and was impressed first and foremost by the service, but also loved the attention to detail when it came to the "green" side of the Hotel. I loved the layout of the hotel and it's not a long drive to get downtown to all the action on The Strip. I was given an upper floor room and had a nice view of downtown and the pool; a perfect combo if you ask me. Wish I had more time to stay in Vegas as the pool looked great and the area offered lots of parks. I was in town for a concert at the Desert Breeze Park and was able to make it a nice bike ride and leave my car parked. Back to the hotel, the shower was nice (still wish there was more water pressure at these new hotels, but I'm sure government regulations are to blame and not the hotels) and really enjoyed the cleanliness and comfort of the room, bed and furnishings. All the essentials for a road warrior are present and the Wi-Fi is included. Even actual computer access is provided for guests (with printing!). Like many of these boutique chains, breakfast is provided, but the Element takes it a step further and offers a nice array of prepared options as well as the cold bar and dry goods. Thanks guys! Even though I love the Wynn on the Strip, the Element will be my new goto Hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: HadleySJ
Reviews.Content: Great proximity to Red Rocks (climbing, hiking, biking), the rooms were very attractive and comfortable. The pool has cabanas and a shallow part that toddlers can walk in, and the complementary breakfast was good quality (smoothies in shot glasses, egg or egg white breakfast sandwiches on English muffins along with a lot of other options). It's quite a feat to find an aesthetically pleasing hotel with nice design features that is also welcoming to dogs and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s20mark
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the kids for a Spring Break basketball tourney. Loved this place. The staff is great Cynthia that manages the morning free breakfast service is as sweet as they come. Breakfast is much better than the typical hotel continental. The kids especially loved the smoothies. The rooms are clean and modern. The kids also loved the wii in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL ESPECIALLY WITH DOGS”
Reviews.Author: jj_fergy
Reviews.Content: Great practical hotel, clean, great staff and they allow dogs. Rooms with kitchen, wonderful breakfast. Stayed there for 2 months and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and practical”
Reviews.Author: Migratory_Margie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night prior to a trip to Death Valley. This would absolutely be my first choice if I were coming to Las Vegas for any reason other than gambling. The hotel is airy and attractive. We had a room with two beds, a desk, couch and full kitchen. It even had a DVD player to go with the flat screen TV. The staff was very pleasant and it is by far the best "free" breakfast I've had in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: spikeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go hiking in the surrounding area, but it was also just a short 9 mile drive to the strip. The beds are very comfortable with many pillows, down comforters and soft mattresses. The rooms are complete with a small kitchen area, desk, couch and bed. Perfect for long stays. The breakfast is great- good food and real plates and silverware. No plastic. Staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “When you need to get away from Vegas without leaving town.”
Reviews.Author: dacky2
Reviews.Content: Once we stayed here, we have never stayed anywhere else in Las Vegas. No slots, no smoke. Just clean, quiet, and classy. The clientele has always been an interesing mix of business travelers, sports teams, and families like us that want to have fun without exposing our kids to the nastier pleasures of vegas. Not a fratboy in sight... It's a clean-well-lighted place.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: To begin, this is my 2nd review for this hotel. Much like the first time, I have nothing but positive things to say about this Element by Westin. I like it that much. This hotel is out near Summerlin, but from reading reviews, this doesn't seem to be a barrier for people visiting Las Vegas and the Strip. It shouldn't be, either. Whereas many, or nearly all, hotels in Las Vegas treat you like a sucker tourist, this Element hotel treats you like a human being and appeals to the proactive, independent traveler. You can still expect great service, but you aren't going to be subjected to gimmicks that many Vegas hotels use to get your precious dollars. In fact, I'd have no problem saying this is the PERFECT hotel for business travelers. The rooms are airy, bright, and clean. There is lots of lighting via overheads and lamps so you can get work done, but enough flexibility to dim the lights for a quiet evening. The kitchenette is fully stocked with cookware, glasses, and utensils so you can bring your own groceries and setup base like you're at home. The television channel lineup is very similar to what you'd have at home, and includes a few HD selections. The grounds are immaculately maintained and welcoming, while the staff are all friendly and helpful. I've always felt that my requests to the front desk staff were carried out in a very positive and hospitable manner. The location is prime if you have business on the west side of LV, and there is plenty of retail to the south (off Flamingo) and to the north (off Charleston). It drives me nuts that the hotel is so close to the more upscale neighborhoods in Summerlin as I hope to someday live in this area. Nonetheless, it is nice to drive by such nicely maintained neighborhoods that have very little traffic during most of the day. The morning complimentary breakfast is one of the best I've ever had. The standard continental items are always there, along with some select pastries, and each day there is a unique hot item such as an English Muffin breakfast sandwich, or an egg white breakfast burrito. The miniature smoothies in shot glasses are a nice touch that I fully took advantage of. There is also an evening reception that I have no doubt it just as good, but my work schedule prevented me from partaking. There is nothing more to say, except, give this place a try. I don't think it is possible to leave this hotel dissatisfied. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence H
Reviews.Content: I have traveled around the world and stay at some very fancy hotels.....this is one of the best, what a wonderful hotel. I will be back again next week. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: GaslampGM
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectation. The staff wer all exceptionally profesional and very friendly. The rooms were modern, well appointed, and beautifully furnished. Breakfast had a wondeful variety. There were choices that could cover evryone's preferences, ie. very healthy, or not. The pool area has two gazebo's and a large number of lounges. The gym were very well thought out and had an huge amount of equipment. The grounds were landscaped with indiginous desert plants and trees. Overall, what a wonderful weekend. I would highly recommend this hotel for the single business person or families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: topgun151
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and thought the hotel was solid. I gave it 3 stars, however would feel it would fit better with a 3.5 star rating. Don't think it quite makes a 4 or 5 in my book. The hotel is right off the highway and away from the craziness of "the Strip" area. However, you can easily get to the strip within 15 - 20 minutes, in fact the hotel sits on a nice hill where you can see the strip out of most of the hotel windows in the distance. Upon check in, I was sent to a room that had the beds turned up against the wall and it appears they were airing it out. No big deal, they gave me another room. Beds were very comfortable and I slept very well. Staff was friendly and I enjoyed the free breakfast the next morning which were actual breakfast sandwiches instead of just continental items. It is also worth noting that this is the hotel President Obama slept in in late January of 2012 for a night while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good value. Good breakfast. Non Smoking Hotel in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: doubler71
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for those who don't want to be right in the hustle and bustle of the Strip. My wife, son and I visited a family member in Las Vegas. My wife and I do NOT like the smell of cigarette smoke. Plus, she is 9 months pregnant. We also wanted a place without all of the crazy traffic. This place fits the bill perfectly. It is about 20 minutes away from the Strip, right off of the 215 freeway. It is an eco friendly hotel. There is plenty of parking. Room was good sized. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is complementary and delicious. It is a non smoking hotel, which is PERFECT for my family. If you do want a casino, Red Rocks is not too far, maybe 5 minutes away. There is a fully-stocked kitchen in the room, and Albertson's is about a 3 minute drive away. The minor inconveniences were that housekeeping takes quite a long time to get to the rooms, and they forgot to restock towels (and they didn't vaccuum/sweep) The other minor inconvenience is that the pool was pretty cold and they advertised it as a heated pool. Red Rocks is very close as well, and we enjoyed a couple of wonderful days of hiking. Pluses definitely beat the minuses by a lot. I would definitely stay again and I would definitely recommend it to a friend. I liked the free internet access. The beds are just as wonderful as everyone says they are.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, excellent place”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my wife, and stayed here over a weekend. Awesome breakfast buffet. Wonderful staff. Very impressed. Room was clean, smelled great, love the design of the room. Thank you Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly! Off the strip, quiet location, easy access off highway.”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: The SPG hotels are our go to hotel chain..... we can usually be assured that we will have a comfortable bed without the lumps and fallen support that you experience at other hotels. This was not a disappointment. We stayed in a studio king room which has a kitchen and full sized frig. Free Wifi, breakfast, and PET FRIENDLY...... Perfect for us! Though there were several pets on the property, we didn't really hear any in their rooms..... Though we did hear the heavy footed neighbors above us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful stay away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbellmom256
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here recently while visiting family, staying in two rooms.The property is small, but very comfortable and lovely and smoke free. Our rooms were modern, clean and maximized for size and function. Both rooms had a kitchenette with a full sized refrigerator, oven and microwave. The purpose of our trip was to visit family living close by, so the kitchen was barely used, but very nice to have. We did have a problem with allergies from the down comforter that I missed on the first night, but a quick call to housekeeping solved that. Every employee from the desk to housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. A wonderful continental breakfast is served M-F, including egg sandwiches, cereals, mini muffins, and the best smoothie shots. On weekends, trays of eggs, sausage and pancakes are added. Loved the breakfast! Only thing I would change is the addition of fresh fruit, but the dried fruit and smoothies helped. The rooms overlooking the pool were very quiet. We did have one night there was a party downstairs in the lobby area that had music blasting beyond loud. It was right below us, so we felt it through the walls of our room. We were so tired, it didn't keep us up, so we didn't complain. I think it ended at 10 pm, but I had earplugs, so I'm not sure. I guess if you are staying over a Saturday, and it is important to sleep early that night (not often in LV) ask to be in a room away from any parties planned. We would definitely stay here again. We love going to Red Rock, Bonnie Springs and Valley of Fire, and this is close to that without going through LV traffic. The Strip is only 20 minutes away for casinos, shopping and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Quaint.. just perfect”
Reviews.Author: EnGee1976
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent a few days in Vegas in order to get licensed and married on 11/11/11. The time spent at the Element exceeded my expectations. Although there were other guests it was very very quiet and peaceful. I can't even begin to tell you how comfortable the beds are. My husband wants to know where the Westin purchases the heavely beds so we can buy one for our home. This hotel also offers breakfast daily. It was like having breakfast with family. And we were surprised by the selections. Eggs, sandwiches,cereal, yogurt, bacon.. you name it. Most hotel free breakfasts consist of small bagels and pastries. I have stayed at several hotels on the strip as well as the Red Rocks Resort. This one I would definitely stay at again. The only con I have is there was no bathtub, shower only but I can live with that. :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Red Rock Canyon”
Reviews.Author: acon234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Rooms, suites are large, clean and have everything you could need. Great location if you are spending time in Red Rock, climbing, hiking, etc. Hotel breakfast is excellent, staff is helpful and nice. Wifi is fast and included in price. The only negative I can think of is it is very close to the highway (215), our room faced the road but even then it wasn't bad, but you could hear it a bit. Ask for a room on the other side of the building if you think this would bother you. Overall, really great place. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here !!!”
Reviews.Author: PJinStony
Reviews.Content: We planned a four night stay here during a recent visit to Las Vegas, and liked it so much we stayed over an extra day. Hotel is very clean and modern. Staff are very freindly and helpful. The rooms have lots of amenities including a full sized refrigerators and very comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've encountered anywhere - don't miss out on the in-house smoothies and the baby muffins. If you don't have a car you may find the location a bit remote, but if you do, it's only minutes down the 215 to shopping, resaurants, and the Red Rock Resort. The Strip is about 20 minutes away in normal traffic. Excellent base for day trips to Red Rock Canyon, Death Valley, and/or the Valley of Fire. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Nerzie
Reviews.Content: What a nice, clean, modern hotel! Clean lines, good breakfast, quiet, relaxed, and friendly. I would definitely choose to stay here if I find myself in Vegas again. In fact, I am going to be on the look out for other Element hotels in future places I visit. This is a great place to stay if your purpose in Vegas is not just "the Strip". We stayed for a couple of nights and this was our base to Death Valley and hiking in Red Rocks. It was far from the traffic and congestion of the Strip but our room had a nice view at night of the lights from the Strip. Our room had a nice kitchenette. The price for such a pleasant, clean room with breakfast was unbeatable in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mike83204
Reviews.Content: All suites, ultra modern, very clean. Beautiful pool. Well equipped fitness center. Best suite style room that I've experienced in this price range. Dog friendly. Nice breakfast. Stayed here for the Gran Fondo Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Food at this place is freakin 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: Donald B
Reviews.Content: I will tell you this much, I had some of the very best food on this earth, so much so that I ask WHO the chef was and I was told it is Chef Clay Denny, this cat is by far the best omellete maker I have ever had.... I think Om - E - Let this chef cook for me again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhiAE01
Reviews.Content: So, the first thing you should know is that this hotel is in the middle of no-where suburbia. So make sure to have a car. But, other than that it is GREAT. All the rooms are actually "suites" with a kitchenette including full size fridge. Great for anyone who needs to refrigerate something (new moms, diabetics, etc.) because unlike other Las Vegas hotels you actually can use your fridge it isn't just for the mini-bar items. A note of caution to families with little kids though, the rooms don't have bathtubs. Nice big walk-in showers with a huge rain head or hand wand, but no tub. The hotel also serves a wonderful breakfast -- I had an egg, cheese and bacon bagel sandwich and a egg, cheese and ham english muffin sandwich on the two days I was there (vegie options also available). This was in addition to the smoothie shooters which were available. Free wifi throughout -- why don't all hotels have this? GREAT exercise room with two elliptical machines (with tv), two treadmills (with tv) and a few other machines in addition to weights, stability ball, etc. Nice and big. One other downside was that it was not well insulated from road noise -- not enough to bother me, but it was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but outstanding accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay a night here while hopping between a personal trip to Vegas and a week of business. First of all this hotel is in a prime location off 215 in the upscale Summerlin area. It is directly next to a gas station and a medical park. I imagine many of the guests here are long term visitors to the cancer institute next door. It is very easy to get around this area due to mostly local traffic. The hotel as well as the rooms remind me a lot of Aloft hotels by W Hotels, but with a stronger focus on green and long term accommodations. Both of these properties are a part of Starwood Preferred Guest. The property lives up to the other reviews but I found that the hallway noise in the mornings was loud enough to make it difficult to sleep in. I think part of this is due to the guest rooms having hard flooring. Heavy suitcases and hard floors tends to be a loud combo. For those looking for fun, the Red Rock is a 4 minute drive north. I will stay here if I am ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the concept, hate the noise”
Reviews.Author: swood99
Reviews.Content: In town on business, so needed a place with reasonable amenities and a good night sleep. Free wifi, good TV selection, kitchenette and comfy bed looked promising, but in the first room I went to, I could hear everything in the room next door (there was an adjoining room door). I knew this would be a problem so asked the manager if he could find me something quieter, so he moved me upstairs. Same setup, same problem, and they couldn't change room types. I can hear every word, sound, conversation and bodily function from the couple next door. When the lights are out, I can see light around all edges of the hallway door, so assuming they did something similar with the adjoining room doors. Staff is friendly but unhelpful. Never been in a hotel with such poor sound insulation - without a good night's sleep it's hard to appreciate what they did right with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Many return customers and very pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: cjg87
Reviews.Content: This is a small-suite extended stay, limited service hotel in NW Vegas across the street from a medical research center. The breakfast is hot, and both the food staff and the other employees are super nice. Larger rooms have a 2-burner stove, and all have microwaves and refrigerators. Many guests bring their pets. I got the impression that many are also repeat customers. The property is kept clean, and it looks new (but is not). It is far from the Strip, but close to Summerlin residences and businesses.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: RozMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Had some family stay at this hotel which was also the place of our rehearsal dinner before our wedding. They let family bring in food and wine, etc which was a great savings. I also appreciated the eco friendliness and the fact that it did not have a casino attached to it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, intimate and hip - great hotel and better location”
Reviews.Author: jj_fergy
Reviews.Content: My first time in an Element by Westin and I was very happily surprised. The rooms are spacious with 3/4 kitchen and the hotel is nice an small - NO big casino to walk through. Staff was very friendly and the morning breakfast is actually good, my favorite was the egg white, cheese and tomato on a english muffin. If you are in Vegas for business and you need to be near Summerlin - this is the place to stay you will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly, highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobosh35
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was able to accomodate our every need. First off this hotel is eco friendly which is great. Secondly pet friendly another plus for our family. This hotel is classy and sophisticated, the decor is very contemporary. It has everything 24 hr fitness center everything is brand new. The kitchen comes with everything bowls, silverware, stainless steel appliances, etc. The linens are plush and the bathroom shower is to die for. State of the art everything. You will not be dissappointed what so ever. Plus the price is right. A little off the strip but 10 to 12 minutes was well worth the drive for what you get. Love the brand new feeling and I will be going here next time we are in Vegas. Happy Travels Kirsten and Vince B.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent non-casino hotel with a real breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsavvy888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is completely non-Vegas in a sense that it provides upscale family accommodations, extremely comfortable beds, superb customer service, and a very delicious hot breakfast buffet (using real plates and cutlery, not paper and plastic). It's small, friendly and is a completely wonderful surprise. Overall, Element is a fantastic find if you are not staying on the Strip. It's clean, friendly, and worth it. A very good experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “They didn't miss a detail...”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 'element by Westin' for a night while on our way to California. We had a nice room/suite complete with kitchenette and office area. Much less stodgy than a typical Westin, but still very upscale. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, and a cool dip in their pool in the warm desert air. Will stay here next time we come to Vegas rather than on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: msefron
Reviews.Content: The Element is a wonderful hotel! It's location off the strip is great, too. We had the pool to ourselves most days. It is much smaller than the strip hotels, but that added to it's greatness since we had our 2 small girls with us. There are plenty of places to eat nearby; our room had a full kitchen - albeit on a smaller scale...stove, microwave, dishwasher, full size refrigerator. All that being said the hotel is very 'green' - in a good way! Woods that are used are not endanger, nor are they endangering anything (rain forests, animals...). There is nothing I didn't love about this hotel. I plan to take some decorating ideas from the hotel to use in my own home. Do I need to even mention the beds?? I told my girls it felt like sleeping on a cloud. Ahh!! The hotel staff was all very pleasant!! The breakfast every morning was like no other hotel. Don't forget to try the smoothies!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: cherylping
Reviews.Content: Was nicely surprised at how close it was from the 215 freeway, darling and i were expecting to drive a little further than that. it's about a 15min drive from the strip, not too bad at all, especially if you want to be away from the drinking and smoking crowd. Element had a very family-friendly environment, but at the same time, a very comfortable setting for couples. We got a studio, and it had a nice sized kitchen. (I had requested a room away from the freeway when I did my reservation, but because we checked in late, we couldn't get one, and was put in a room that was facing the freeway but had an amazing view.) One of our nights, we got hungry but there was nothing really open on the way back to the hotel so we went to the store to pick up food and went back to the hotel to cook a little. was real convenient. though it was a little weird to cook on a vacation, it felt a little like home. the bed was awesomely comfortable, the pillows were amazing. I was really really tempted to take the pillows home, since i've been looking FOREVER for pillows like that. the blinds didn't work that well, which was sad because we shut the blinds when we took an afternoon nap after a long hike at red rock canyons, and couldn't get it back up to enjoy the view. that was rather disappointing, especially since we had a spectacular view of the red rocks against the blue sky outside our window. real nice to wake up to a view like that. there wasn't that much of a noise from the freeway though, except one of a police siren that we heard. also, the "raining" shower head wasn't working well either, it had some leaking problems so we just used the regular one. didn't bother us that much, though we were a tad disappointed. (i'd minus half a star for the not so functional stuff, though it wasn't that huge a deal) breakfast was pretty good, healthy to say the least. they had these fruit smoothie served in shot glasses that were snapped up pretty quick, everyone loved it. the eggs were meh only though. but the receptionist Chris, who checked us in and later granted us a later checkout, was real helpful and very friendly. Thank you so much for making our stay awesome! :)

Reviews.Title: “High design at unbelievably cheap prices and five star service with great amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Ike03
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here and was bowled over by the high quality of the property. From service, to our fantastic room equiped with everthing you would ever need (including a complete kitchen) to full free hot complimentary breakfast, free newspapers, free wifi, free parking, great pool with outdoor showers and plentiful pool towels. Every employee I encountered was happy, smiling, and friendly. Pet friendly to boot! Five star hotels could learn a lesson from Element by Westin. I've stayed at many a St. Regis, Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, or Mandarin Oriental and not had as good room design or service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TDmize
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Rooms were good sized. Bathroom was of good size with and it had a great shower with very modern decor. The location is right next to the freeway, but the noise wasnt bad at all. Also there was a little minimart/gas station next to the hotel for minor items needed. The free breakfast in the morning was great, its not your average half assed hotel "continental" breakfast either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLMENCWA
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean room & the kitchen in the room was very clean, comfortable bed, great shower , friendly staff and pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lovely_Llama
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, nice rooms and great breakfasts - We'd definitely stay here again. We stayed here for 2 nights before moving to a hotel on the strip for the last 2. We had a car though and, if we were to do it again, we'd likely just spend the entire time based at the Element as getting around the city was made very easy from the hotel... The hotel rooms were a little on the small side but the beds very comfortable, the little kitchen area was well-equipped (and spotless) and the bathroom was a good size and spotless as well. The business centre area was quite nice as well with several computers and printers. A little tip - the breakfast is lovely but try to get there a little early as they don't replenish the food too much as you get closer to the end of breakfast time. We stayed there at the same time as a huge group of sports teams and needless to say it was slim pickings when we ate -- but in all fairness, we arrived 20 minutes before the scheduled end of breakfast so we couldn't really complain (although some other patrons did!). Overall, good value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “If you like Ikea this is your place”
Reviews.Author: callia02
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay in a "green" hotel but found Element to be full of contradictions. "Green" seemed synonymous with cheap. The cabinets and decor were reminescent of a dorm room and an awkward lay-out for the tv. Uncomfortable couch and devoid of character or personality. The low flow shower simply meant lack of luxury and the floor appeared to be laminate rather than environmentally friendly cork or bamboo. The strangest thing was the "appetizers" advertised by the front desk which turned out to be pigs in the blanket (little hot dogs) and soda. Really?! The lobby area was relaxing and it would be great to have a juice or wine bar there or the opportunity for room service. I think it is a good idea that they have shampoo dispensers to cut down on post-consumer waste and I like the tea that they have avaialble throughout the day. I paid the same rate at Cosmopolitan this year, so I feel that I paid Cosmopolitan prices for a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: mcarson2
Reviews.Content: We stayed first and last nights after hiking Death Valley. Beautiful hotel in terms of aesthetics, and the in-suite kitchen and furnishings were wonderful. Beds also super comfy, and the bathroom was gorgeous. The complimentary breakfast was also excellent. No waffle machine and cold rolls. Instead had a variety of breakfast sandwiches, fresh-squeezed juices, fruit, etc. Lobby area nicely appointed, including board games, and the pool area was spotless. Staff super helpful and kind, and located across the street from some nice restaurants. A bit pricier, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Easy”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMaven
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a six-night stay at the Element in February. I'm in Vegas at least once a year to visit the in-laws who retired to Summerlin. This was the most comfortable I've been on any of my visits. Have stayed on the Strip in the past, but more recently at the Suncoast and J.W. Marriot. While the Marriot is swanky (if a little ragged lately), the whole resort setting is very tiresome to me. The Element offered much greater ease overall - easy to park, easy to get to the room, easy to get (free) breakfast, easy to work out, easy to get to the in-laws' place. Spare, economical room furnishings - very West Elm, or maybe Ikea. I liked the layout of our one-bedroom suite: ample kitchen space, tidy living room with shelving space for books, magazines, phones, etc., comfortable bedroom. Plenty of non-traditional space to store clothing in a cupboard. I liked the flooring - not carpeted in the living area. Bathroom was adequate, shower was nice. Wished there was a tub to relax in, but not a big loss that there wasn't. Little issues: soap dish in bathroom was cheap plastic and made an awful squeaking sound when moved. Windows (which actually open a bit to let in fresh air) did not seal tightly - latches were broken, windows were off their tracks). When wind was howling it was an issue. Traffic noise from freeway was steady - might bother some, but was mostly white noise to me. Housekeeping only left one regular coffee kit until we asked for two, and neglected to leave dishwasher soap after we'd used the only one there. Plusses: great lobby with a great breakfast and a delightful woman staffing it most mornings; roomy work out area with free weights starting at five pounds (thank you! many places start at 20 pounds); ability to hook up my computer to TV in room and run Netflix and Pandora through television speaker; easy location to get to - 10 minutes from airport, 10 minutes to the Strip, 15 minutes to the in-laws, 15 minutes to Red Rock Canyon (go - really - and take the Calico Tank hike). Right across the street: wonderful spot called Rachael's for alternative breakfasts and sandwiches; new wine bar/Neapolitan pizza joint (didn't try); serviceable Japanese Teppanyaki Room. Obviously not the spot if you're looking for a "Vegas-y" experience, but definitely the spot if you want a quiet place that makes it easier to get done whatever you came to town for.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not honor your reservation- they left us stranded!”
Reviews.Author: Scrabblemom
Reviews.Content: We booked here thru AARP Expedia for three nights. When we arrived after midnight in Las Vegas (flight delay!) the hotel clerk told us they had no record of our reservation and made no attempt to find us a room elsewhere. The hotel staff were rude and obnoxious. Expedia did nothing to get us another room. And then I found out when I got home that they charged us anyhow!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: BearSchmei
Reviews.Content: Pet freindly, but they tried to charge $50 per stay. This was a policy they started 2 weeks ago. Since we were not informed of this policy when booking they waived the charge. Full breakfast was very nice with efficient and friendly staff. Fresh fruit juices, pancakes, eggs, sausage in addition to the usual fare. Free parking. No wifi in rooms though. Outdoor BBQ grill and AMAZING fitness machienes! Top of the lime treadmills, elipticals and bikes by lifetime fitness. Interactive personal screen/TV monitor. Limited weight selection. Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome oasis”
Reviews.Author: Cascade29
Reviews.Content: We were midway through a road trip around the southwest when we found ourselves in the Las Vegas area. We had intended to skip the entire area, but as it turns out, all roads lead to Vegas and it was completely impractical to drive around. We wanted to avoid the strip but also did not want a “cheap Vegas motel” (shudder). It turns out, we found all this and more at the Element. The hotel was honestly a welcome oasis in the desert of Las Vegas. It was away from the strip and was a “no-gaming facility”. It had the atmosphere of a spa with the nightly rate of a cheap motel. It was so clean, so fresh, and so beautiful that we contemplated changing our plans to stay an additional night. They are pet-friendly, but the rooms were so clean that you would not believe that other dogs had stayed there before. We were happy to have a nice hotel accept our four legged travel companion and respect our ability to clean up after her (instead of some hotels that give you the most disgusting room in the building). I was so impressed with the room that I even took photos of it to share with friends back at home. It was beautiful, modern, and (as I said before) sparkling clean. There was even a nice kitchen area to round out the amenities of the room. The bed was unimaginably cloud-soft while still providing good support. The outdoor pool was clean and refreshing (and cold, but the air temperature was over 100 degrees so the temperature of the water was appreciated). There was even free food in the lobby (a nacho bar) for us to nibble on while hanging out. Wait – hanging out in the lobby? I’d never done that in a hotel before, but it seemed so natural at the Element. After a wonderful night of sleep, we decided to do something we had never done before… hang out in the room right up until check out time. We had places to go and things to see on our road trip, but the room at the Element was so refreshing that we just wanted to sit back and relax and enjoy for a few extra hours. We would never go to Las Vegas as a vacation destination… but we would definitely book a few nights at the Element to enjoy the stay once again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - Good value”
Reviews.Author: phil760b
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. Rooms were of good size for one or two persons; more persons may be a little cramped. Bathroom was of good size with an excellent shower and modern facilities. Hotel is a ways away from the strip and the airport and so it would be of note that cabs, towncars etc. to the hotel can be expensive ($50-60 one way --> airport). No hotel shuttle. Parking is free. No casino ☺ and that cuts down on the noise factor. Breakfast was standard - included in price fare - with plenty to eat. Computer with printer available in the lobby in case one needs to check the net or print up boarding passes; there is wireless internet throughout the hotel as well at no charge. Heard some dogs barking in one of the rooms but that was a minor inconvenience. Needed some houskeeping supplies at 3:30am - spoke with front desk and supplies arrived within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my 5 nights at the Element”
Reviews.Author: bklyngirl7
Reviews.Content: First time at the Element brand. Room was small but comfortable & clean, Very nice bathroom with rain shower and hand spray. I did have to move the floor lamp to keep from banging my knee when I got out of bed and there were no drawers but these were not big issues. Complimentary breakfast was very nice, good coffee and a nice variety from day to day. Staff, especially in the breakfast area, were very nice and accomodating. I would stay at the Element again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: ashevilleluva
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to Vegas for a conference. Having never been to Las Vegas before, I was a bit concerned knowing it's reputation of being a party city. I was concerned for the quality of stay and safety. I was, however, pleasantly surprised when I arrived at The Element. Though it is a good 20 minutes from The Strip, it is a little gem which allows comfort and ease during the stay. I found all of the staff I interacted with to be top notch and very professional. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was quite tasty and generous. The rooms were very comfortable and having a full kitchen was a blessing. The only drawback is that it is in the middle of a suburb and there is no surrounding food stores or restaurants to speak of, nor a shuttle service. Beings we were dropped off at the hotel, we had to walk to Albertsons and back - which was interesting. If you have a rental, this is no problem. This was my first time staying in an Element property and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - modern retreat”
Reviews.Author: kearz10
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Wanted something off the strip which is about 15-20 minutes away by car. Enjoyed the decor, the layout, and the amenities. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. The bed was definitely heavenly. The hotel was pretty busy due to the holiday (NY Eve), but you wouldn't know it except for the very full parking lot. The rooms are pretty quiet - never heard much. Will definitely look for this new chain in my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay indeed”
Reviews.Author: Rolf88
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed 3 nights, it was fantastic, top location for us, very clean good breakfast and wonderful staff. This will be our hotel in Las Vegas from now on. Rolf Steffen

Reviews.Title: “A Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassJetSetter
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at an Element hotel and it was fantastic. The green tile work in the room added a great touch to it and it felt as if I were at home. The bed was comfy. This is a great hotel if you are not concerned about always being on the Strip, like me. Also, the complimentary breakfast that is provided in the lobby -- wow! It's awesome and it's not just continental. You have pancakes, toast, eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, smoothies, juices, etc. Very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GriffinCrowley
Reviews.Content: I have been blessed to travel the world and stay in many 4 and 5 star hotels, but this fabulous new hotel concept from Westin called "Element" just blew me away. Absolutely loved it! It is luxurious and elegant, yet so practical. Everything is included in your nightly rate. No extra fees for anything. An amazing fresh hot breakfast included, parking included, gym included, wireless internet in the rooms included, great computers and printers in the lobby included, print your flight vouchers, it's all free! They even have mountain bikes you can use for free! Take them up on the bike ride because Red Rock is stunning and a short ride from the hotel. There is also a beautiful park within easy walking distance of this lovely hotel. I must mention the decor. My hubby came up with the a word to perfectly describe it - TechnoZen. It is so modern and high tech, yet very soothing and zen. Loved it! Our room was spacious, beautiful and fully loaded with everything we needed to cook. My hubby and I both have blood sugar issues and I enjoy being able to prepare some of our food in the room when we travel. This great kitchen set up made it so easy. I was able to make full meals, including steak, fish, chicken. The stove had a fan (for the fish smell :o), the plates were plentiful and ranged from regular to extra large, there was a full size refrigerator, you name it, it was included. Oh, and I mustn't forget to mention the beautiful rainfall shower. You usually only see these at spas - a really love touch. The layout of the entire room and the use of space is splendid. The window coverings even look high tech, sort of grey mesh with full blackout coverings behind the mesh. The bed was oh so comfortable, and housekeeping did an excellent job everyday. Last but far from lest, the front desk staff (Chris and Brendon) treated us like family. This hotel, which is ideal for the business travelers gets a lot of repeat business and I thought it was so charming that the guys at the front desk seemed to know everyone's name and great them in the morning when they came down for breakfast and to read the newspaper. Congratulations Westin on creating such a uniquely practical and luxurious hotel. I have already made reservations to return next year. Anyone headed for Las Vegas and/or Summerlin you have to check this out :o) My Very Best, AnnaLyn Griffin "The Grateful Traveler"

Reviews.Title: “All This and They Take Pets, Too!!!”
Reviews.Author: chasandy
Reviews.Content: While in Vegas for an overnight, we were looking for a pet friendly hotel and happened upon this beautiful place. It's very chic and modern, and very eco friendly. Our room had a computer station, flat screen tv, fridge, microwave, toaster, dishes for 2 and even a cork screw. The bed was heavenly with a fluffy duvet. Breakfast was ample with burritos, danish, coffee etc. Even a gas grill outside for long-term guests. The place is in an upscale area of Summerlin and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “In my "Element" at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottas66
Reviews.Content: Element is a lovely hotel with all the flavor of a Westin, but all the added amenities of a mid-brand property. The breakfast was one of the better I've had at a mid brand location, with a good mix between traditional hot breakfast items and healthier items, and fantastic coffee! The living room concept is great - doesn't feel cheap or crowded at breakfast like some other properties, and you can even take your breakfast out in the "back yard" and dine al fresco. Speaking of the back yard, there is a grill and prep facility that is open for guests to grill out, and while the pool is small, it is very nicely appointed. The decor throughout the hotel is comfortable and welcoming, yet elegant in a minimalist, modern style. The hotel is a new-build that obviously takes it's LEED rating seriously, and I definitely appreciated the sustainable features such as low water and electricity use. Definitely felt the low environmental footprint here. The bathroom was fantastic, and perhaps the best low-water shower I've ever used - I wanted to move into it! If you have the option to rent a hybrid car, you get priority parking, too! The welcome letter from the General Manager in the room pointing out the features of the hotel was informal and bursting with personality, and the staff we encountered during our stay were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Elements is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Tachiebluebird
Reviews.Content: From start to finish an absolutely amazing stay; we even cancelled our high rise on the Strip to stay here one last night. The design just wows - interior and exterior finishes are incredible, the hotel layout is slightly nontraditional for a hotel (and makes much more sense), and the design elements are creative and refreshing. I appreciated every detail: rocks and bamboo in the common areas, sunken living room areas with sectional sofas, beautifully designed pool and cabanas, fitness gym, grilling area, exterior landscaping, etc., everything was so well-thought out. Staff was all-around fantastic, professional, cheerful, and helpful. Rooms are very comfortable, quiet and well-designed with a compact functional kitchen area and an amazing bed. Shower in bathroom is fabulous (although tilting the hand held and setting to your height works much better than the overhead rain shower) and there were no wasteful plastic toiletry bottles (integrated into shower instead). View out the back onto the pool and to the mountains was very pleasant. Absolutely one of the best hotel breakfasts ever and served/presented exceptionally well. Hallelujah, no ridiculous waffle maker. Fabulous fruit smoothie shots. And the coffee, this is serious coffee, no messing around. Very close to Red Rocks and about a 30 minute drive to the Strip down Flamingo. Convenient location right next to 215 and adjacent to the Summerlin neighborhood which offers lots of dining, shopping and activity options. Highly recommend Elements. It just made our trip. Cannot wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: jtjedeb
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Las Vegas,and you have a rental car,this hotel is the absolute number one! The car is necessary because of it's location,summerlin. A lovely area only a fifteen minute drive from the strip. This means that at night it's quiet and the Heavenly beds will make sure you'll have the best night rest you have ever had! Hotel staff couldn't be nicer and genuinely interested and hard working to make your stay something you won't forget. Breakfast is great with a variety of stuff to choose from. There is also a great outdoor pool and a 24 hour fitness room with brand new equipment.Complementary wifi was also very fast with a steady signal throughout the entire hotel. We have stayed in other hotels in Vegas but this is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: HahTraveler
Reviews.Content: A family function in Vegas. My brother booked on hotwire and this is the hotel he ended up getting. So my parents and I decided to stay at the same hotel. Good AAA rates. My wife and I booked a studio suite. Checking in was simple enough. There is even a kiosk at which you can check in if you have the credit card you paid with. I wanted to confirm we weren't on the highway side of the hotel so I checked in with the staff. The guy seemed somewhat new or in training. He did a fine job but didn't confirm the rate, so I went back later as I was bringing my bags in to double check. The whole place is very unique. Four floors, two wings. One wing perpendicular to Hwy 215, the other parallel. The lobby has an open air look, and some fresh herbal kind of smell. Furniture is contemporary retro. Like those chic 50s/60s movies, simple geometric shapes. Subtle grays, whites, and muted greens. Very unique. The elevator was broken on floor four you had to use the service entrance to the elevator. We were on third floor, room 312. A studio king. Great to have the kitchen. Full size fridge, toaster, little sink, dishwasher, dishes, utensils, a sauce pan and sautee pan, 2 burner stove (no oven.) A safe I could fit our laptop into. No dresser, just shelves in a few places and a closet to hang your clothes. A functional desk for the laptop. I couldn't find a wired internet connection, but wireless was snappy (Did speedtest.net @ ~5 Mbit/s upload and download) and pretty much just worked when I found the unsecured network named "element" and connected. There is a "media cube" that you can connect RCA Video/Audio, 3.5mm phone jack, and/or RGB cable into, as well as HDMI. The TV just pipes in the audio video if you plug it in. We watched some Netflix watch now from our laptop without a hitch. The room has a DVD player so you can rent or bring DVDs or pay-per-view (though you'd be insane at 15.99 per movie for PPV!) There was a printed note on the "media box" that said they had cables at the front desk. We called about an audio cable and they said, "Sorry, we don't have any cables" - and they even seemed a little surprised. That wasn't good. It's okay that they don't have them - if they don't have official papers saying they do! We didn't use the pool but my brother and kids did. Despite the welcome sheet saying, "our pool is 85 degrees year round", it was NOT 85 degrees. In the hot weather, they had decided to turn off the heater, I think - because my brother and kids didn't use it for long. Also has a strange 6" deep section that is like a 1/3rd of the pool, and it goes to about 4.5' deep at the deepest where it isn't the 6" shelf. My wife made oatmeal on the stove with the saucepan, used their utensils, all purpose measuring cup, and dishwasher, worked like we were at home. Place has a nice big couch, wraps around the corner of the room with a sofa sleeper. The bed was marvelous. No cotton blankets which is what my wife and I prefer- only feather/polyester comforters, my wife was allergic to the comforter but they did bring us up a wool blanket when we called and asked. Bathroom was great. Good lighting, big mirror, a low counter with unique sink that sat on top. Rain-style shower with a separate sprayer on a hose. Only thing some might not like is that it is shower only and/or that the shower is clear glass floor to ceiling. So if you have a teenager that wants to shower without being seen, you must give them the whole bathroom. A/C unit didn't work quite right. Seemed to blow forever and never say it was colder but froze us. Couldn't figure out what was wrong, but we had to just turn it up/down depending on how we felt, just couldn't set it. The thermostat in my parents' room (a 1 bedroom, room 422) seemed to work fine. Bedroom door in the 1 bedroom suites is a sliding door, it doesn't lock. Most hotels have a booklet with detailed information on services and amenities. We looked all over for it when we showed up. They had little "official" scraps of paper around describing various things, and one letter size sheet with a sentence about each amenity. Quite the paltry documentation. The breakfast was good on Sunday (hot eggs/sausage/pancakes, Cereals/pastries/juices/breads/yogurt/fruit) and okay on Monday (same cold stuff, but only hot things were a breakfast burrito). They did offer a healthy alternative to the burrito - one made with egg whites and no sausage. SUMMARY: Service - The minuses were for the only okay trained desk staff, no audio cable when they said they have cables, for saying the pool is 85 when it wasn't, seemed a little short staffed. Still haven't fixed the elevators (there is an earlier post about that) Cleanliness - was impeccable. Location - A little out of the way, but on 215 for good access to west Vegas area. Value - With out AAA rate, the value was excellent. All annoyances were pretty minor, and for the price, easily overlooked. Rooms - There were a few quirks (blankets, A/C), and the contemporary angular furniture isn't the most comfortable, but the beds are great Sleep Quality - Excellent I would recommend. We will likely come back if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to try the Element brand”
Reviews.Author: CBBrown67
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in Las Vegas 1 day before my friend, so I decided to try the Element brand as I had not stayed in one and am a Platinum member of Starwood Preferred Guest. I read the reviews on this site and was a little excited to see the hotel and the concept. When I arrived, the guy who checked me in was pleasant enough, but he did not acknowledge me as a Platinum member, nor did he offer the Platinum amenity. I also kind of thought I might be given an upgraded room since the parking lot was less than half full. No such luck. With that said, I was nothing but pleased with the room, and would happily stay there again if I had to spend time in the area alone. I loved having a kitchen and full refrigerator. I loved the room, and those Heavenly Beds. The following morning one of the elevators was not working properly and several people were complaining that they were stuck on the elevator for a few minutes. When myself and another guest complained to the front desk, we were told that the elevator repair company had been notified and that it would be fixed. I guess I expected them to shut down that elevator while waiting on a repairman, but no such luck. I hope no one else got stuck, but I'm afraid they did. Other than that, I had a great stay at the Element in Summerlin, and even won a few hundred dollars on a slot machine the next exit up 215 at Red Rock Casino.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, modern lifestyle hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gecko007Munich
Reviews.Content: the complete other way to stay in Las Vegas! for everybody who likes to see and visit all famous places, Restaurants, Casinos, Shows and... and....and in Las Vegas, but during the night you are looking about a nice qnd quiet place to rest and sleep, here are absolutly right. 15 to 20 minutes by car and you are around the strip, 10 minutes and you stay in a famous desert landscape. the hotel is modern with nice rooms incl. a kitchen whatever you need you will find! Outdoor pool, bar..... that's the place!

Reviews.Title: “SPG Platinum member review”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumPete
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone I am an SPG Platinum member and stayed at the Element LV Summerlin last week. This is my first stay at Element by Westin and I was very impressed. This is a brand new hotel for Starwoods. The hotel is located in Summerlin NV and its about a 20 min drive from airport and 15-20 drive to the "strip". The hotel is located right off the exit on 215. There is free parking and a pool for guest to use. Checkin was a breeze and I was given a 4th floor( top floor) 1 bedroom suite. The room overlooked the pool and rear parking lot and had distance views of the strip. The room itself was very nice. It had a full kitchen small living room with sofa/flat screen and a bedroom with another flat screen in it. The bathroom was nice with a rain shower head. There is a buffet breakfast in the am and free internet with printer in the lobby. I did use the fitness center and it had treadmills/elipitcal and weights. I did not use internet in the room since I did not have my laptop with me. I was in Vegas to play in the WSOP. I paid $100 for the room and was very impressed w/ the quality and amenties that the hotel has to offer. The value propostion is there because if you want something away from the strip this hotel cant be beat. For $100 I got a great room, free breakfast, free internet, pool and gym. The only thing was I had to drive to the strip but i wanted to check out this SPG property and thats why I stayed. It was worth the trip and the rest of my time I stayed at the Encore and Westin LV. Please ready my reviews on both. Any questions please let me know

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; morning front desk staff need to find another job that does not involve dealing with people.”
Reviews.Author: RolloOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and was totally impressed with the layout of the hotel, the in-room space and amenities, the first-rate gym and pool, and the excellent breakfasts. Evening snacks could have been more varied and plentiful thoug but the hostess was superb in all respects. Excellent location right off the 215 which is not nearly as noisy as some have written. That said, the young women on the morning shifts, and one rather large one working nights, seem to have thought that their looks would have landed them in a far more glitzy property than this one, where they could meet their first in a series of male benefactors. Too bad girls, you're just not cute enough. They acted as if questions from guests were totally unwarranted and bothersome. With forced smiles they responded only after they exhausted some guests. And that's when they were in attendance! I'm sorry but as nice as the hotel is physically, and as convenient, it's really not all that hard to find people to work there who are a) friendly, b) competent, c) pleased to have a job where they can shine and perhaps be noticed, and d) leaving an overall positive impression with guests. This is not a hard problem to solve, given the unemployment rate in Las Vegas. Since others have written similar comments, one wonders about the general manager, who never made an appearance during my stay to introduce himself to guests at breakfast or evening get togethers. Someone needs to take notice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place - would recommend it to anyone without reservation”
Reviews.Author: snowinpalm
Reviews.Content: What a find! The hotel was within a reasonable distance of the Convention Center (10 minutes) and very economical. I had a 'suite' which had more than I needed but certainly all I could want. It included a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, fully equipped kitchen (pots, pans, dishes, toaster, etc.), desk and extra couch. All that plus a king sized bed which was very comfortable. It is exceptionally clean and the hotel staff are great. The breakfast was included and very well balanced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Green”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: Coincidently, we met the very nice couple from Alabama that wrote the previous review during our stay at this property. We were saddened to hear they had problems during their anniversary trip. Fortunately, we had a very different experience. We found Element Las Vegas to be an exceptional property. The staff was helpful and accommodating. Our room – well, the entire property for that matter --was extraordinarily clean. The rooms have full kitchens equipped with cookware and dishes. We loved the option of preparing our own food during our stay. If cooking during your getaway isn’t for you, no worries…. all of the great casual dining venues of the west valley: Cheesecake Factory, Roy’s, Fleming’s, etc., are located along the Charleston BLVD corridor a few miles north of the hotel. The Element is Westin’s “green” concept. The environmentally friendly theme is found throughout the property. I can appreciate the responsible use of natural resources; however, the “hybrid only” parking space at the hotel’s main entrance was over the top, if not misguided and a tiny bit elitist. The driver of a gas-guzzling Hybrid Cadillac Escalade enjoys up front parking while the driver of a 40+ MPG, non-hybrid but fuel-efficient, Ford Focus must park with the masses of the unwashed. Beyond the cliché, a really cool “green” feature is the hotel room windows that actually open wide for fresh air. Unfortunately, our room faced the 215 Beltway so we couldn’t take advantage this because of the traffic noise… oh well, maybe next time. Some minor drawbacks: 1) Kitchen Flooring. Because it is a hard surface, expect noise to come through the ceiling from people walking on the floor above if staying anywhere but the top floor. This strip of flooring runs the entire lenght of the room on one side. 2) WiFi. The signal in our room was weak. Bring an ethernet cable. Tree-hugger or not, Element is fine place to lay your head in “Sin City.” I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxious, disgusting, horrid, and Unbelievable Customer Service on Anniversay Weekend”
Reviews.Author: greyhatt
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Element by Westin. I checked in on Thursday, 10 June, and I am scheduled to check out on Monday, 14 June. We were staying there for our Anniversary trip. Our room was supposed to be pre-paid on 07 June in an amount of $467.04. On 12 June, we noticed that the charge for the room was not billed but an authorization for $722.80 was being held on the account. The authorization for $722.80 consisted of $467.04 for the room and $255.80 for incidentals. Here is the problem. The front desk manager told us that the Westin tried to bill our debit card on 07 June and the card declined. I know this is not true because I called my bank and the transaction never tried to come through and the funds were always there there anyway. I asked the front desk manager for a transaction number from the bank that was given from the alleged decline and she was unable to provide that transaction number. The other part of the problem is that the Westin alleges that since our debit card was declined on 07 June, they charged us a higher amount for incidentals. Usually, incidentals are $100 but when a card is declined this amount increases to $100 per day. This makes no sense because if the lesser amount, $467.04, was allegedly declined, then how can the Westin authorize the higher amount of $722.80? If the smaller amount was allegedly unavailable then the higher amount should have never been able to be authorized if, indeed, the funds were unavailable. The funds were always available. Also, if this policy is true this further makes no sense because if we were supposed to be charged a $100 per day incidental rate since the card allegedly declined, then why were incidentals authorized at $255.80 instead of $400 ($100 per day for 4 days, the length of my reservation). This is the bottom line, our debit card was authorized at a higher amount for incidentals since the room and tax amount allegedly declined. So, we were penalized for a decline that never happened. And, it appears that the Westin just pulled a figure for incidentals out of the sky since the higher/penalized incidental rate does not even match the rate in the Westin policy. The front desk manager told us there was nothing she could do since it was Saturday and she told us we could call the general manager. So, I called the general manager, David Smith, and talked to him about our concerns. David Smith was beyond terrible. He told me that he was not at the hotel, that he was in New York City and if the front desk manager said there was nothing she could do then nothing could be done. He proceeded to tell me that he would not do anything to address my concern and when I checked out everything would balance out. He told me that he would not make any calls to Westin at a higher level to see how this happened; he also proceeded to tell me that even if he was willing to make some calls nothing could be done today since it's Saturday. His unwillingness to even address my concern was appalling. Before I left the front desk, the front desk manager ended up calling higher level Westin and the authorization was released and she billed the debit card for the room and tax. Funny how she was able to do that when she and her general manager told me that nothing could be done. Technically, my issue was resolved but I am writing this review because of the horrible way David Smith talked to me on the phone. We could have taken our business anywhere, but we chose to come to the Westin. What a mistake !! Is this Westin policy? Does the Westin not train their management staff in customer service? My request was for the Westin to correct an error that they made and all I received was disrespect and lack of concern. I expected him to at least be willing to investigate the issue, but he told me he would not do anything. I don't work directly in customer service but I am expected to address the concerns of those who are impacted by what I do and the decisions I make. I try my best to be responsive and professional because that is my job and it's just common courtesy, This is a fairly new property and if the Westin continues to treat their customers this way they won't be around for long. At this point, we have no interest in ever staying at a Element by Westin property. We would much rather spend our money at a property where the management has a willingness to address concerns and/or operate in accordance with the policies and procedures of the organization. Perhaps that's why the customer service was so bad because there is no structure in the organization. We are so disappointed. We don't make a habit of paying people to disrespect us. Apparently a paying customer has little significance until a review like this is written. A very sad state.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at Elements”
Reviews.Author: GunAsh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most relaxing part of our 5 day visit to Vegas and Grand Canyon. This place offers very comfortable rooms with every amenity that you can think of ( a small kitchen included). Staff is good. Includes morning breakfast. We had booked this place for the first three days and for the next two days we wanted to stay at the Strip of Las Vegas and chose Paris Hotel. Staying in Paris hotel after Elements was quite disappointing. Would recommend Elements hotel to anyone going to Vegas. 10 minutes drive from Elements are Red Rock Canyon which is very beautiful and Scenic. Do not miss if you are planning to be in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS!”
Reviews.Author: dcss_au
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing.. yes it's not on the strip.. yes you need a car (but you need one if staying in vegas away from the strip), but this hotel makes up for it on so many levels. The hotel is modern, clean - fantastic fitness centre, breakie, snacks in the afternoon. The staff are prompt, friendly and high calibre. I stayed here for 6 nights, and didn't want to leave!!! Close to red rock . .. a must see for nature lovers!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful - nice to be off the strip”
Reviews.Author: kh221903
Reviews.Content: great breakfast! wish they had lunch and dinner. so nice to have a full kitchen in room though!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tsi2quick
Reviews.Content: Was on business and stayed just one night at this property but it was a nice stay. Arrived around 8pm to a lobby full of people celebrating St. Patrick's day, looked like they were having a good time. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room was a total suite with a kitchen, couch, nice work desk area, flat screen tv on a swivel so you can rotate it to where you are at in the room. The bed was very comfortable and I had no problems sleeping. There is also complimentary internet access which was nice. The bathroom was modern with a glass enclosed shower area. Plenty big inside and included a rain shower head which was ok but necessarily something I would prefer. A lot of counter space IMO (at least for one male traveler!). Towels were a bit stiff and scratchy though. The lobby area serves a nice complimentary breakfast starting at 6:30am, plenty of choices. You can also pick up a Wall Street Journal or USA Today newspaper in the lobby. We used the hotels meeting room adjacent to the lobby and it worked out well. They brought in more tables and chairs as we requested them and helped setup the room as desired. Great service there. I saw a pool and nice BBQ grill outside but didn't fo further to investigate either. The location of this hotel is very near Red Rock Casino if that gives you an idea of where it is. Definitely removed from the "Vegasy" feel of the strip or downtown, which IMO, was very nice. In fact, my wife and I went to Vegas back in September and stayed on the strip but I think if we go back we'll take a look at this property and drive into the strip versus staying in the middle of it. Being able to leave behind the hustle and bustle to go "home" to a more normal area is nice. Our room faced the highway outside and you could hear the road noise a bit but nothing that kept me awake, however a colleague said it did keep her awake so its something to consider if you are a really light sleeper. Overall a great hotel, very modern chic, almost sterile feeling but has a lot to offer and the price is right. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Xmas getaway”
Reviews.Author: dexwood
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!! The concept & room layout of this hotel is refreshing & I totally enjoyed the two day I spent there. So much so that now for every trip, I am first looking to see if there is one in the city that I going to. The room was the most effective studio suite that I have ever been into; including that of some of my friends condos. It has a full mini kitchen on one side, 37" HDTV, King bed (Westin) & a L shape sofa to complete the room. The bathroom is also spacious; the shower head is huge & directly above your head that makes your showers like rain. It is also adjustable for your individual preference. This is ideal for the budget conscious traveler {either business, small family, couple or extended stays} & you get the feeling that you're getting a great deal for what you get verses the cost. It is located about 10mins drive from the downtown strip in a business area. There is no slots or any Vegas machines on premises. Oh, did I mention the healthy complimentary buffet breakfast: fresh fruits, juice, coffee, tea, muffins, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Anti-Vegas Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllisRedding
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel for anyone looking for a quiet place to stay in LV. The concept is terrific: peaceful, clean, healthy, green. The lobby has a green tea scent that we really liked. We called ahead and got a reduced rate from what the website offered and clearance to bring our 65 lb golden retriever. It is a pet friendly hotel and we were grateful for that. We forgot a dog bowl but they hooked us up. The rooms are quaint -- even a little tight if you use the pull out couch --- but the space is useful... Like a modern loft. Great sink and showerhead with no little plastic bottles to end up in a landfill. Room also has a nice sized HDTV that rotates so it can be used if you're at the desk, in bed or in the kitchenette. The free breakfast was just right -- warm breakfast sandwiches, mini fruit smoothies, pastries, etc. On Saturday they added pancakes, sausage and eggs. Pool looked small but nice - my parents used it - free cabanas and outside towels. Only complaints would be that rooms facing the 215 freeway will hear a good deal of highway noise. The Element is practically on top of it... So request a room on the quiet side. Also, the grounds are minimalist desert landscape -- fits the green concept but if you bring a dog there isn't grass anywhere in the area...a nice park is about a mile away. My wife & I were very impressed with the Element and will return and look for other Elements in different cities. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but does the in room fridge need to be so big and noisy?”
Reviews.Author: Davidbignose!
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try out this new brand as I try to be eco friendly in my life. We arrived very late 01.00, but were quickly checked in and slept well, but the in-room kitchen area does have a ridiculously large fridge freezer which we found noisy. The bed as ever in SPG was comfortable, and we loved the long breakfast self service, with more than acceptable tasty mass prepared food. My only concern is that the kitchen area in the bedroom really is oversized as most folks would eat out and the waste of energy of the overlarge fridge is unnecessary. For an eco lodging option, the pens are friendly, the bedroom flooring socially responsible bamboo we think, and the light bulbs energy saving. The bathroom certainly reinvents hotel bathrooms well, but the shower cubicle could be smaller as it was more space than water...thus it felt cold when one was having a shower. Outside there is a pool, very well kept and I did a few lengths.....as well as ample towels and chairs/loungers. All in all a refreshing style in the oversized Las Vegas indulgence market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Comfortable, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad06
Reviews.Content: The Element was a very comfortable and quiet hotel. Be prepared for a long ride to the Strip. It's about 30 minutes from the strip by taxi/shuttle. A great location if your visiting for a conference at the Red Rocks Resort and Spa. The bedroom was quiet and the room was very clean. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: imaeyeguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel because of the relatively high rating at tripadvisor. We visit Vegas twice a year for leisure and decided to give this "green" hotel a try. I can say that this hotel is best suited for some types of travelers, but not every type. It is new, clean, and modern in appearance. I have no complaints in regards to the quality of the hotel. Although our one bedroom was quite cramped. The "studio" gives you a more wide open feel. I would highly recommend it for the business traveler since it has every accommodation and facility to support the business man/woman. Wireless internet is free and they have free fax and printing services. Very nice free breakfast buffet before heading out to the meetings. I would also recommend this for a family traveling to Vegas for some specific event (wedding, convention,etc.). Because it has a full kitchen in every room, it will suit families with children to the tee. I would also recommend this hotel for the buddies on a golf trip. There are so many exceptional golf courses within minutes (Red Rock Arroyo, Bear's Best, Siena). Golf buddies don't need posh accommodations, just a place to relax after 36 holes. I would NOT recommend this hotel for the romantic getaway. Sorry to say that we couldn't find any redeeming "romantic" qualities about this hotel. It's modern appearance, makes it slightly cold. There are no restaurants in the hotel, you would need to take the 15 to 20 minute trip to the strip. But then, coming back to the element after dinner just doesn't give you that "romantic feeling". I would likely not return to this hotel unless I was on business, going golfing only, or with my kids. Romantic getaway with the wife, No way.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here again.......”
Reviews.Author: ballwhacker
Reviews.Content: Great location for my golfing needs (TPC Summerlin) 10min away. Strip an easy drive 15min. Great contemporary "W" style/feel to the place, rooms with full fridge/kitchen...new Does always smell nice, any part of the hotel. Great beds/bath Great gym Great DIY washing room. Great morning breakfast's/after noon snack/s Free internet/nice TV/DVD Outside BBQ & pool if you don't want to smole out your room. 5 min to Red Rock Resort Casino + some restaurants. I had a room well away from the elevators (by luck) but they do seem to make a loud noise when the door opens, so ask to be away from them. I'll be back next year (used STARWOOD points) for this trip

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMom10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in beautiful Summerlin. We stayed here for a friends wedding that was in LV. It is about 10-12min from the strip, located right off the 215fwy. When you walk in the hotel it smells refreshing like green tea. Very modern decor. The rooms was AMAZING!!! We stayed in the one bedroom suite. Had a full kitchen, two TVs one in the living room and one in the bedroom. I don't care to stay in hotels, but this hotel totally different! It's CLEAN, the staff is friendly, the bed is COZY!!! LOVED IT!!!I can't rave enough. I have stayed in 5 star hotels and this by far has been the best!!!! The hotel is non smoking and there isnt a casino. However, there is a great casino about 2min away in Summerlin called the Red Rock- upscale casino from what I saw in the inside. If you have kids there is a great park just one street from the hotel.
